suncertify.ui.client
Class ConnectionDialog

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Dialog
                  javax.swing.JDialog
                      suncertify.ui.client.ConnectionDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class ConnectionDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog

A dialog to prompt the selection for a database file resides in file system or connecting to a database network service.

Confirmation for selecting a local/remote database can be verified by calling getOption(), if returned value is equals to ConnectionDialog.Option.CONNECT.
The entries in an instance of this dialog depends on connection type passed through its constructor:

  • If a ConnectionDialog.ConnectionType.LOCAL was chosen the dialog will display a FileSelectionComponent to allow selection for a database file resides in file system, the file can be retrieved after confirms by calling getSelectedLocalFile().
  • If a ConnectionDialog.ConnectionType.REMOTE was chosen the dialog will display three text fields, host name, service name, and service port. Entries for those fields can be got by calling getHost(), getServiceName(), and getPort().
All getter methods will returns null in case user option is ConnectionDialog.Option.CANCEL. Utility method showConnectionDialog() will show the dialog and returns the user selected option. If prompted user clicks on connect button, getOption() returns ConnectionDialog.Option.CONNECT, the dialog will be hide in case the entries are valid , if not, a warning red message will be displayed to notify the user regard missing or defected entries and it will remain visible.

Author:
Mohammad S. Abdellatif
See Also:

Constructor Detail

ConnectionDialog

public ConnectionDialog(java.awt.Frame parent,
                        ConnectionDialog.ConnectionType connectionType,
                        boolean modal)
Construct a new dialog with its parent frame is parent and display the entries according to connection type connectionType.

If passed modal is true, parent frame parent will be blocked until this dialog is closed, otherwise, no blocking is performed.

Parameters:
parent - parent frame from which this dialog is displayed.
connectionType - the dialog entries are displayed according to this passed type.
modal - if true, dialog will blocks it`s parent frame, otherwise, no blocking is performed.

getSelectedLocalFile

public java.io.File getSelectedLocalFile()
Returns the local database file selected by user.

If getConnectionType() is equals to ConnectionDialog.ConnectionType.REMOTE it returns null, otherwise the entry is returned.

Returns:
local database file selected by the user.
